whitebox.geospatialfiles.shapefile.attributes

Class DBFReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • whitebox.geospatialfiles.shapefile.attributes.DBFBase
      • whitebox.geospatialfiles.shapefile.attributes.DBFReader

  • public class DBFReader
extends DBFBase
    DBFReader class can creates objects to represent DBF data. This Class is used to read data from a DBF file. Meta data and records can be queried against this document.

    DBFReader cannot write anything to a DBF file. For creating DBF files use DBFWriter.

    Fetching record is possible only in the forward direction and cannot re-wound. In such situation, a suggested approach is to reconstruct the object.

    The nextRecord() method returns an array of Objects and the types of these Object are as follows:

    xBase TypeJava Type
    CString
    NInteger
    FDouble
    LBoolean
    Djava.util.Date

      • DBFReader

        public DBFReader(java.io.InputStream in)
          throws DBFException
        Initializes a DBFReader object. When this constructor returns the object will have completed reading the hader (meta date) and header information can be quried there on. And it will be ready to return the first row.
        Parameters:
        InputStream - where the data is read from.
        Throws:
        DBFException

        public java.lang.Object[] nextRecord()

      • getRecord

        public java.lang.Object[] getRecord(int n)
                             throws DBFException
        Reads the returns the nth row in the DBF stream.
        Parameters:
        n - The zero-based record number.
        Returns:
        The nth row as an Object array. Types of the elements these arrays follow the convention mentioned in the class description.
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • getRecords

        public java.lang.Object[] getRecords(int startingRecord,
                                     int endingRecord)
                              throws DBFException
        Reads the records from startingRecord to endingRecord from the table.
        Parameters:
        startingRecord - the first record read (zero-based).
        endingRecord - the last record read (note the range is inclusive of endingRecord).
        Returns:
        an Object[] array where each element is another Object[] array of record values.
        Throws:
        DBFException
